attributes.action: VOTE AGAINST THE 2 AMENDMENTS TO THE ARTICLE 50 BILL
attributes.background: The Prime Minister must have as much bargaining power as possible to enter negotiations with the European Union.The two amendments made by the House of Lords  could seriously weaken her hand in negotiations. It is essential Britain gets the best deal as possible on leaving the European Union.

rejection.details:
The two amendments to the European Union (Notification of Withdrawal) Bill  2016-17 were disagreed with by the House of Commons on 13 March 2017.

You can find out more about the debate on these amendments, including how to watch the debate and read a transcript, here:

http://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2017/january/commons-european-union-notification-of-withdrawal-bill/
